title: rev-1
description:
Next >> https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/109274811/

Revision #1 of my experimental battle system.

See the original video for some basics and more info (revision #4, or something): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-YNLfTnlnfQ

This is the initial version, basically it's just a camera that follows an object on a stage. You can fool around with the zoom variable, but anything less than 100 doesn't work. Space bar to show a jumping animation.

Credits:
• Programming, animation all by me, in Scratch (https://scratch.mit.edu).
• Character art was taken from the Scratch costume library.
• Background was ripped from Lunar Legend (by Game Arts).
• Sounds were ripped from Dragon Quest IV (DS remake; by Square Enix).
• Music was ripped from Grandia Parallel Trippers: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gwzrGxjcLCs
• Battle system concept pretty much copied from Grandia and similar games (by Game Arts, Square Enix).

title: rev-12
description:
Previous << https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/109041291/
Next >> https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/110462581/

Revision #12 of my experimental battle system.

See the original video for some basics and more info (revision #4, or something): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-YNLfTnlnfQ

IMPORTANT UPDATE: When you click the green flag to run the program, either press the key "b" to open up a battle demo or "e" to open up a walkaround demo. You can also switch between demos by pressing "b" or "e", respectively.

A few new updates this time:
• Enemies now do damage to you! ..but not really. A little text will display over a hurt character, showing how much damage was dealt. You don't have any health, though, so it doesn't *really* matter.
• I guess there's a walkaround experiment now?
• You also get a new character to play with (I added it to make sure characters-following-characters in the walkaround worked).

Credits:
• Programming, animation all by me, in Scratch (https://scratch.mit.edu).
• Character art was taken from the Scratch costume library.
• Backgrounds were ripped from Lunar Legend (by Game Arts).
• Sounds were ripped from Dragon Quest IV (DS remake; by Square Enix).
• Music was ripped from Grandia Parallel Trippers: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8XvjiCK-x0EU57w_n6Kv4mgi9S93vH9-
• Battle system concept pretty much copied from Grandia and similar games (by Game Arts, Square Enix).

IMPORTANT UPDATE: When you click the green flag to run the program, either press the key "b" to open up a battle demo or "e" to open up a walkaround demo. You can also switch between demos by pressing "b" or "e", respectively.

Fixed another couple bugs and tweaks:
• Fixed walking in the battle system after exiting the walkaround.
• Fixed walking off of the screen.
• Updated height vectors for walkaround.
• Added the ability to look up in the walkaround, use the up arrow key.

title: rev-15 HYPE
description:
Previous << https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/110570586/
Next >> https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/123666478/

Revision #15 of my experimental battle system.

See the original video for some basics and more info (revision #4, or something): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-YNLfTnlnfQ

IMPORTANT UPDATE: When you click the green flag to run the program, either press the key "b" to open up a battle demo or "e" to open up a walkaround demo. You can also switch between demos by pressing "b" or "e", respectively.

All I did in this update was change the font of text and such. Sounds small but if you compare it to rev-14 it really is a huge improvement! (Also I tweaked the animation slightly - it gives you a chance to see the amount of damage you've done for half a second before lending the game back to real-time.)

Also it's been like five months since I've worked on this project. For a sense of scale, between rev-1 and rev-14 about a million Scratch projects were shared. Between rev-14 and rev-15, about TEN million Scratch projects were shared. Yikes.

Credits:
• Programming, animation all by me, in Scratch (https://scratch.mit.edu).
• Character art was taken from the Scratch costume library.
• Backgrounds were ripped from Lunar Legend (by Game Arts).
• Sounds were ripped from Dragon Quest IV (DS remake; by Square Enix).
• Music was ripped from Grandia Parallel Trippers: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8XvjiCK-x0EU57w_n6Kv4mgi9S93vH9-
• Font hacked from here: http://font.ubuntu.com/
 - Here's the terrible script I used to get the font into a zip for usage with this project: https://gist.github.com/liam4/67f37e83b9e7f638d1cbac3d4547817c
• Battle system concept pretty much copied from Grandia and similar games (by Game Arts, Square Enix).

title: rev-17
description:
Previous << https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/123666478/
Next >> https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/124620835/

Revision #17 of my experimental battle system.

See the original video for some basics and more info (revision #4, or something): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-YNLfTnlnfQ

IMPORTANT UPDATE: When you click the green flag to run the program, either press the key "b" to open up a battle demo or "e" to open up a walkaround demo. You can also switch between demos by pressing "b" or "e", respectively.

Quite a few updates this time:
• A better-looking health display.
• All text is looking shinier than ever, and it's code is just so much better. Compare with rev-16!
• Monsters now attack Player 3, finally!
• Probably fixed a few other bugs.
• Text layering is broken. Hey ST, can we please let sprites move off the stage's view? That would be aweeesome.
• Added some (project) tags. Probably won't keep up with these though!
• Changed the music and background because meh it's time for a change. Also since a lot has happened since the last time I've changed the music/backdrop. Maybe the new thumbnail will catch someone's eye!

Credits:
• Programming, animation all by me, in Scratch (https://scratch.mit.edu).
• Character art was taken from the Scratch costume library.
• Backgrounds were ripped from Lunar Legend (by Game Arts).
• Sounds were ripped from Dragon Quest IV (DS remake; by Square Enix).
• Music was ripped from Grandia Parallel Trippers: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8XvjiCK-x0EU57w_n6Kv4mgi9S93vH9-
• Font hacked from here: http://font.ubuntu.com/
 - Here's the terrible script I used to get the font into a zip for usage with this project: https://gist.github.com/liam4/67f37e83b9e7f638d1cbac3d4547817c

title: rev-18
description:
Previous << https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/124620835/
Next >> https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/124680913/

Revision #18 of my experimental battle system.

Rewrote the entire battle engine. It now resembles Epic Battle Fantasy more than Grandia, for sure, but it's not a terribly un-standard engine now. That's okay though! A Grandia-style battle engine works best when you have an actual environment for characters to move around though, which this does not.

Credits:
• Programming and animation all by me, in Scratch (https://scratch.mit.edu).
• Character art was taken from the Scratch costume library.
• Backgrounds were ripped from Lunar Legend (by Game Arts).
• Sounds were ripped from Dragon Quest IV (DS remake; by Square Enix).
• Music was ripped from Grandia Parallel Trippers: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8XvjiCK-x0EU57w_n6Kv4mgi9S93vH9-

title: rev-19
description:
Previous << https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/124670250/
Next >> https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/124761842/

Revision #19 of my experimental battle system.

Added a new fireball attack, as well as an order-changing option when it's your command. Try it! (There's no real use for it right now, but later you could use it to apply [for example] an attack buff to your fighter before they hit.)
